sections.title: 1. Festivals Overview
paragraphs: Minas Gerais is known for historic religious processions, arts festivals, and iconic food celebrations.

sections.title: 2. Festival Calendar (By Month)
paragraphs:
Jul:
Festival de Inverno de Ouro Preto

Aug–Sep:
Festa do Rosário, Semana da Pátria

Oct–Nov:
Festival do Queijo, Festival de Cinema

sections.title: 3. Top Annual Festivals (Flagship Events)
paragraphs: Festival de Inverno de Ouro Preto

sections.title: 5. Festival Types & Categories
paragraphs: Religious, arts, culinary, and folk traditions dominate the calendar.

sections.title: 6. Religious & Faith-Based Festivals
paragraphs: Semana Santa and Rosário celebrations are central.

sections.title: 7. Music & Dance Festivals
paragraphs: Concerts and dance events are common in urban centers.

sections.title: 8. Folk & Traditional Celebrations
paragraphs: Congado and June festivals preserve heritage.

sections.title: 9. Food & Gastronomy Festivals
paragraphs: Cheese, coffee, and wine festivals define Minas cuisine.

sections.title: 10. Carnival & Pre-Carnival Events
paragraphs: Belo Horizonte’s carnival is among Brazil’s fastest-growing.

sections.title: 11. Indigenous & Afro-Brazilian Festivals
paragraphs: Afro-Brazilian traditions appear in Congado and regional festivals.

sections.title: 12. State & Municipal Holidays
paragraphs: Local holy days are celebrated in historic towns.

sections.title: 13. Festival History & Origins
paragraphs: Colonial history and baroque culture shape festival traditions.

sections.title: 14. Cultural Significance & Symbolism
paragraphs: Festivals symbolize faith, heritage, and culinary pride.

sections.title: 15. Cost & Accessibility
paragraphs: Most public events are free; select concerts are ticketed.

sections.title: 16. Where Festivals Take Place
paragraphs: Belo Horizonte, Ouro Preto, and historic towns host key events.

sections.title: 17. Best Time to Visit for Festivals
paragraphs: July for winter arts festivals; March–April for Semana Santa.

sections.title: 18. Local Customs & Etiquette
paragraphs: Respect church processions and historic site rules.

sections.title: 19. Safety & Crowd Tips
paragraphs: Plan for steep historic streets and large crowds.

sections.title: 20. Family-Friendly vs Adult-Oriented Festivals
paragraphs: Most cultural and religious events are family-friendly.

sections.title: 21. Festival Food, Drinks & Traditions
paragraphs: Expect queijo, coffee, and regional sweets.

sections.title: 23. Fun Facts About Local Festivals
paragraphs: Minas Gerais is Brazil’s cheese capital.
Ouro Preto’s winter festival is internationally known.

sections.title: 24. FAQs About Festivals in Minas Gerais
paragraphs:
Best food festival?
Festa do Queijo.

Main arts event?
Festival de Inverno.

sections.title: 25. Related Festivals in Nearby Regions
paragraphs: Combine with Espírito Santo and Rio de Janeiro festivals.

sections.title: 26. Practical Planning Tips
paragraphs: Reserve accommodations early for Semana Santa and July.

sections.title: 27. Festival Updates & Annual Changes
paragraphs: Check municipal and church calendars for date changes.

sections.title: 28. Sources & Cultural References
paragraphs: Minas tourism portals and historic town cultural institutes.

sections.title: 29. Festival Map
paragraphs: Key hubs: Belo Horizonte, Ouro Preto, and Tiradentes.

sections.title: 30. Final Summary: Festival Identity of Minas Gerais
paragraphs: Minas Gerais celebrates faith, history, and cuisine in a deeply traditional festival culture.
